Utterance: Hi, Ellie!
Hi there! It’s so nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been doing well. I actually painted a couple more pieces!
That’s fantastic! What inspired those new pieces?
One was about the beach, and the other was just some abstract colors.
I love that you’re experimenting with different styles. How did it feel to create those?
Really good! It’s like a release for me.
That’s wonderful to hear. Are you planning to share your art with anyone?
I might. I’ve thought about posting them online.
That’s a great idea! Sharing your work can be a big step. How do you feel about that?
A little nervous, but excited too.
That’s completely normal. What’s the worst that could happen?
I guess people might not like it, but I’m trying to focus on the positives.
That’s a healthy mindset. Remember, art is subjective. The most important thing is that you enjoy the process.
True.
Have you had any interactions with your brother since we last spoke?
Yeah, we had a heart-to-heart. It felt good to clear the air.
That’s great progress! What did you talk about?
Just how we both feel overwhelmed sometimes and how we can support each other.
That’s a huge step towards building a stronger relationship. How did he respond?
He was receptive. It felt like we were on the same page for once.
That’s wonderful. It’s important to feel supported by family. Have you thought about how you can maintain that open communication?
I think just checking in more often would help.
Absolutely. Regular check-ins can strengthen your bond. How about your mindfulness practice? Have you been able to keep it up?
Yes! I’ve been doing a few minutes each morning and it really helps set my day.
That’s fantastic! Have you noticed any changes in your mood or stress levels?
Definitely. I feel more centered and less reactive.
That’s a great benefit. Would you like to try incorporating some mindfulness techniques into your art practice?
That sounds interesting. How would that work?
We could explore being present while you create, focusing on the colors and textures without judgment.
I’d like that!
Great! Let’s plan to do that in our next session. Is there anything else you’d like to work on today?
I’ve been thinking about my feelings of guilt regarding spending.
That’s an important topic. Can you tell me more about that?
I feel guilty when I buy things for myself, like art supplies.
It’s natural to feel that way, especially when you’re married. Have you talked to your wife about it?
Not really. I don’t want her to think I’m being irresponsible.
It might help to have an open conversation about your feelings. You both can set some boundaries together.
That makes sense.
Remember, it’s important to balance self-care with financial responsibility.
Yeah, I want to be more mindful about it.
That’s a great goal. We can explore budgeting strategies if you’d like.
I’d appreciate that.
Perfect! Let’s work on that together. Before we end today, is there anything you’d like to set as a goal for our next session?
I want to share my artwork with at least one person.
That’s a wonderful goal! I’ll be excited to hear how it goes.
Thanks, Ellie!
You’re doing amazing work. I look forward to our next session. Take care!
See you next week!
